name: Musical Instruments 2 Quiz | Musical Instruments | 10 Questions

questions.text: What musical instrument did Pee Wee Russell play?
questions.explanation:
Clarinet.

	Pee Wee Russell was known for his unique style consisting of squeaks and overtones and a mournful expression. He began with Bix Beiderbeck and Frank Trumbuer in the 20's.

questions.text: There are 52 white keys on a piano. How many black keys are there?
questions.explanation:
36.

	The piano was derived from the harpsichord and the clavichord.

questions.text: What instrument did Julie Andrews play in 'The Sound Of Music'?
questions.explanation:
Guitar.

	Julie was born in England. She received a Golden Globe Award for best actress and an Oscar for her role in "Mary Poppins".

questions.text: Which is not a part of the clarinet ?
questions.explanation:
Slide.

	The predecessor of the clarinet was the chalumeau. It was improved into the clarinet and accepted into the orchestra during the 18th century.

questions.text: Of the brass and the woodwind families, which one does the English Horn belong to?
questions.explanation:
Woodwind & woodwind.

	It is actually a deep toned oboe.

questions.text: Which instrument was played by Dick Smothers?
questions.explanation:
Bass Fiddle.

	Dick's first national TV appearance was with his brother on "the Jack Parr Show" in 1961. He is a disciplined regimen of robust workouts and an excellent cook.

questions.text: What is the number of fifes in the painting 'The Spirit Of 76'?
questions.explanation:
1.

	It was painred by Archibald M. Willard for the Philadelphia Centennial Exposition of 1876 and dismissed by art critics as little more than a cartoon. The painting was first known as "Yankee Doodle".

questions.text: Of the clavichord, spinet, or the harpsichord, which one came first?
questions.explanation:
Clavichord & clavichord.

	Popular from the 1400's to the 1800's.

questions.text: For what instrument was 'Rhapsody In Blue' written?
questions.explanation:
Piano.

	It was actually written for Paul Whiteman's jazz band. The piano was the dominating instrument.

questions.text: In the Benny Goodman Trio, what instrument did Teddy Wilson play?
questions.explanation:
Piano.

	The trio started in 1935 with Teddy Wilson on the piano and Gene Krupa on the drums along with Benny. In 1936 he added vibist Lionel Hampton.
